tweets.text: In 2015 the @EnvAgency set a target to better protect 300,000 homes from the risk of flooding by March 2021. We are thrilled to be a part of that milestone. The fully operational #BostonBarrier better protects 13,732 properties from tidal flooding in Boston! #FCERM #TeamEA https://t.co/hXgNEhSWZk

We’ve delivered our largest ever programme of #flood and coastal defence improvements!

Working with partners, we’ve helped protect over 300,000 homes from flooding and supported communities to become more resilient to #ClimateChange

Read more: https://t.co/5Bgax4pg9n

#FCERM https://t.co/mS2pKBFb18

It's hoped over 300,000 homes across the country are now better protected from flooding as the @EnvAgency announces the completion of its £2.6bn defence scheme.

That includes over 400 homes in Croston #Lancashire thanks to a flood storage basin on the River Yarrow... https://t.co/U6QZpiFxno

entity.name: Winterwatch
entity.description: `Winterwatch' continues the BBC's rich tradition of nature documentaries that show off the beauty of the planet and various wildlife species. From their base at the Cairngorms National Park in Scotland, which is twice the size of the Lake District, presenters Chris Packham, Michaela Strachan and Gillian Burke discover ways that the area's animals survive the challenges that come with winter. With short days, plummeting temperatures and a lack of food, cameras monitor the animals' movements. Beavers, pine martens, golden eagles and red squirrels are among the species featured in the programme.

tweets.text: Male beaver, carrying kitt in its mouth @spainsestate @EssexWildlife @EnvAgencyAnglia @SigmaImagingUK @ScotsBeavers #Winterwatch https://t.co/5Wg4OHOpQO

urls.title: JNCC Nature News Spring 2021
urls.description: Quarterly magazine bringing together news and information on JNCC's role in UK and international nature conservation. Our Spring 2021 edition celebrates our 30th anniversary and features some of our key achievements in our journey from 1991 to the present day. This issue also features farewell reflections from our CEO Marcus Yeo and welcomes interim CEO Gemma Harper, "Super Year 2021", a spotlight on Scotland and much more...

tweets.text: Our Spring edition of JNCC Nature News is now online ~ celebrating our forthcoming 30th anniversary & featuring farewell reflections from our @JNCC_UKCEO Marcus Yeo, welcoming interim CEO @Queen_of_Marine Gemma Harper, #Super2021 & much more... Enjoy! https://t.co/CzuUixK9ZK https://t.co/lAM2Xh3u8G
